text: In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God.
speaker: Narrator

text: He was in the beginning with God.
speaker: Narrator

text: All things came into being through Him, and apart from Him nothing came into being that has come into being.
speaker: Narrator

text: In Him was life, and the life was the Light of men.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Light shines in the darkness, and the darkness did not comprehend it.
speaker: Narrator

text: There came a man sent from God, whose name was John.
speaker: Narrator

text: He came as a witness, to testify about the Light, so that all might believe through him.
speaker: Narrator

text: He was not the Light, but he came to testify about the Light.
speaker: Narrator

text: There was the true Light which, coming into the world, enlightens every man.
speaker: Narrator

text: He was in the world, and the world was made through Him, and the world did not know Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: He came to His own, and those who were His own did not receive Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But as many as received Him, to them He gave the right to become children of God, even to those who believe in His name,
speaker: Narrator

text: who were born, not of blood nor of the will of the flesh nor of the will of man, but of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Word became flesh, and dwelt among us, and we saw His glory, glory as of the only begotten from the Father, full of grace and truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: John testified about Him and cried out, saying, “This was He of whom I said, ‘He who comes after me has a higher rank than I, for He existed before me.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: For of His fullness we have all received, and grace upon grace.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Law was given through Moses; grace and truth were realized through Jesus Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: No one has seen God at any time; the only begotten God who is in the bosom of the Father, He has explained Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the testimony of John, when the Jews sent to him priests and Levites from Jerusalem to ask him, “Who are you?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he confessed and did not deny, but confessed, “I am not the Christ.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They asked him, “What then? Are you Elijah?” And he said, “I am not.” “Are you the Prophet?” And he answered, “No.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they said to him, “Who are you, so that we may give an answer to those who sent us? What do you say about yourself?”
speaker: Narrator

text: He said, “I am a voice of one crying in the wilderness, ‘Make straight the way of the Lord,’ as Isaiah the prophet said.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now they had been sent from the Pharisees.
speaker: Narrator

text: They asked him, and said to him, “Why then are you baptizing, if you are not the Christ, nor Elijah, nor the Prophet?”
speaker: Narrator

text: John answered them saying, “I baptize in water, but among you stands One whom you do not know.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is He who comes after me, the thong of whose sandal I am not worthy to untie.”
speaker: Narrator

text: These things took place in Bethany beyond the Jordan, where John was baptizing.
speaker: Narrator

text: The next day he saw Jesus coming to him and said, “Behold, the Lamb of God who takes away the sin of the world!
speaker: Narrator

text: This is He on behalf of whom I said, ‘After me comes a Man who has a higher rank than I, for He existed before me.’
speaker: Narrator

text: I did not recognize Him, but so that He might be manifested to Israel, I came baptizing in water.”
speaker: Narrator

text: John testified saying, “I have seen the Spirit descending as a dove out of heaven, and He remained upon Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: I did not recognize Him, but He who sent me to baptize in water said to me, ‘He upon whom you see the Spirit descending and remaining upon Him, this is the One who baptizes in the Holy Spirit.’
speaker: Narrator

text: I myself have seen, and have testified that this is the Son of God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Again the next day John was standing with two of his disciples,
speaker: Narrator

text: and he looked at Jesus as He walked, and said, “Behold, the Lamb of God!”
speaker: Narrator

text: The two disciples heard him speak, and they followed Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus turned and saw them following, and said to them, “What do you seek?” They said to Him, “Rabbi (which translated means Teacher), where are You staying?”
speaker: Jesus

text: He said to them, “Come, and you will see.” So they came and saw where He was staying; and they stayed with Him that day, for it was about the tenth hour.
speaker: Jesus

text: One of the two who heard John speak and followed Him, was Andrew, Simon Peter’s brother.
speaker: Narrator

text: He found first his own brother Simon and said to him, “We have found the Messiah” (which translated means Christ).
speaker: Narrator

text: He brought him to Jesus. Jesus looked at him and said, “You are Simon the son of John; you shall be called Cephas” (which is translated Peter).
speaker: Jesus

text: The next day He purposed to go into Galilee, and He found Philip. And Jesus said to him, “Follow Me.”
speaker: Jesus

text: Now Philip was from Bethsaida, of the city of Andrew and Peter.
speaker: Narrator

text: Philip found Nathanael and said to him, “We have found Him of whom Moses in the Law and also the Prophets wrote—Jesus of Nazareth, the son of Joseph.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Nathanael said to him, “Can any good thing come out of Nazareth?” Philip said to him, “Come and see.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus saw Nathanael coming to Him, and said of him, “Behold, an Israelite indeed, in whom there is no deceit!”
speaker: Jesus

text: Nathanael said to Him, “How do You know me?” Jesus answered and said to him, “Before Philip called you, when you were under the fig tree, I saw you.”
speaker: Jesus

text: Nathanael answered Him, “Rabbi, You are the Son of God; You are the King of Israel.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered and said to him, “Because I said to you that I saw you under the fig tree, do you believe? You will see greater things than these.”
speaker: Jesus

text: And He said to him, “Truly, truly, I say to you, you will see the heavens opened and the angels of God ascending and descending on the Son of Man.”
speaker: Jesus

text: On the third day there was a wedding in Cana of Galilee, and the mother of Jesus was there;
speaker: Narrator

text: and both Jesus and His disciples were invited to the wedding.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the wine ran out, the mother of Jesus said to Him, “They have no wine.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus said to her, “Woman, what does that have to do with us? My hour has not yet come.”
speaker: Jesus

text: His mother said to the servants, “Whatever He says to you, do it.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now there were six stone waterpots set there for the Jewish custom of purification, containing twenty or thirty gallons each.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to them, “Fill the waterpots with water.” So they filled them up to the brim.
speaker: Jesus

text: And He said to them, “Draw some out now and take it to the headwaiter.” So they took it to him.
speaker: Jesus

text: When the headwaiter tasted the water which had become wine, and did not know where it came from (but the servants who had drawn the water knew), the headwaiter called the bridegroom,
speaker: Narrator

text: and said to him, “Every man serves the good wine first, and when the people have drunk freely, then he serves the poorer wine; but you have kept the good wine until now.”
speaker: Jesus

text: This beginning of His signs Jesus did in Cana of Galilee, and manifested His glory, and His disciples believed in Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: After this He went down to Capernaum, He and His mother and His brothers and His disciples; and they stayed there a few days.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Passover of the Jews was near, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He found in the temple those who were selling oxen and sheep and doves, and the money changers seated at their tables.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He made a scourge of cords, and drove them all out of the temple, with the sheep and the oxen; and He poured out the coins of the money changers and overturned their tables;
speaker: Narrator

text: and to those who were selling the doves He said, “Take these things away; stop making My Father’s house a place of business.”
speaker: Jesus

text: His disciples remembered that it was written, “Zeal for Your house will consume me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Jews then said to Him, “What sign do You show us as your authority for doing these things?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered them, “Destroy this temple, and in three days I will raise it up.”
speaker: Jesus

text: The Jews then said, “It took forty-six years to build this temple, and will You raise it up in three days?”
speaker: Narrator

text: But He was speaking of the temple of His body.
speaker: Narrator

text: So when He was raised from the dead, His disciples remembered that He said this; and they believed the Scripture and the word which Jesus had spoken.
speaker: Jesus

text: Now when He was in Jerusalem at the Passover, during the feast, many believed in His name, observing His signs which He was doing.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus, on His part, was not entrusting Himself to them, for He knew all men,
speaker: Narrator

text: and because He did not need anyone to testify concerning man, for He Himself knew what was in man.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now there was a man of the Pharisees, named Nicodemus, a ruler of the Jews;
speaker: Narrator

text: this man came to Jesus by night and said to Him, “Rabbi, we know that You have come from God as a teacher; for no one can do these signs that You do unless God is with him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered and said to him, “Truly, truly, I say to you, unless one is born again he cannot see the kingdom of God.”
speaker: Jesus

text: Nicodemus said to Him, “How can a man be born when he is old? He cannot enter a second time into his mother’s womb and be born, can he?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered, “Truly, truly, I say to you, unless one is born of water and the Spirit he cannot enter into the kingdom of God.
speaker: Jesus

text: That which is born of the flesh is flesh, and that which is born of the Spirit is spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not be amazed that I said to you, ‘You must be born again.’
speaker: Jesus

text: The wind blows where it wishes and you hear the sound of it, but do not know where it comes from and where it is going; so is everyone who is born of the Spirit.”
speaker: Jesus

text: Nicodemus said to Him, “How can these things be?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered and said to him, “Are you the teacher of Israel and do not understand these things?
speaker: Jesus

text: Truly, truly, I say to you, we speak of what we know and testify of what we have seen, and you do not accept our testimony.
speaker: Jesus

text: If I told you earthly things and you do not believe, how will you believe if I tell you heavenly things?
speaker: Jesus

text: No one has ascended into heaven, but He who descended from heaven: the Son of Man.
speaker: Jesus

text: As Moses lifted up the serpent in the wilderness, even so must the Son of Man be lifted up;
speaker: Jesus

text: so that whoever believes will in Him have eternal life.
speaker: Jesus

text: “For God so loved the world, that He gave His only begotten Son, that whoever believes in Him shall not perish, but have eternal life.
speaker: Jesus

text: For God did not send the Son into the world to judge the world, but that the world might be saved through Him.
speaker: Jesus

text: He who believes in Him is not judged; he who does not believe has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God.
speaker: Jesus

text: This is the judgment, that the Light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the Light, for their deeds were evil.
speaker: Jesus

text: For everyone who does evil hates the Light, and does not come to the Light for fear that his deeds will be exposed.
speaker: Jesus

text: But he who practices the truth comes to the Light, so that his deeds may be manifested as having been wrought in God.”
speaker: Jesus

text: After these things Jesus and His disciples came into the land of Judea, and there He was spending time with them and baptizing.
speaker: Narrator

text: John also was baptizing in Aenon near Salim, because there was much water there; and people were coming and were being baptized—
speaker: Narrator

text: for John had not yet been thrown into prison.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore there arose a discussion on the part of John’s disciples with a Jew about purification.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they came to John and said to him, “Rabbi, He who was with you beyond the Jordan, to whom you have testified, behold, He is baptizing and all are coming to Him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: John answered and said, “A man can receive nothing unless it has been given him from heaven.
speaker: Jesus

text: You yourselves are my witnesses that I said, ‘I am not the Christ,’ but, ‘I have been sent ahead of Him.’
speaker: Jesus

text: He who has the bride is the bridegroom; but the friend of the bridegroom, who stands and hears him, rejoices greatly because of the bridegroom’s voice. So this joy of mine has been made full.
speaker: Jesus

text: He must increase, but I must decrease.
speaker: Jesus

text: “He who comes from above is above all, he who is of the earth is from the earth and speaks of the earth. He who comes from heaven is above all.
speaker: Jesus

text: What He has seen and heard, of that He testifies; and no one receives His testimony.
speaker: Jesus

text: He who has received His testimony has set his seal to this, that God is true.
speaker: Jesus

text: For He whom God has sent speaks the words of God; for He gives the Spirit without measure.
speaker: Jesus

text: The Father loves the Son and has given all things into His hand.
speaker: Jesus

text: He who believes in the Son has eternal life; but he who does not obey the Son will not see life, but the wrath of God abides on him.”
speaker: Jesus

text: Therefore when the Lord knew that the Pharisees had heard that Jesus was making and baptizing more disciples than John
speaker: Narrator

text: (although Jesus Himself was not baptizing, but His disciples were),
speaker: Narrator

text: He left Judea and went away again into Galilee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He had to pass through Samaria.
speaker: Narrator

text: So He came to a city of Samaria called Sychar, near the parcel of ground that Jacob gave to his son Joseph;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Jacob’s well was there. So Jesus, being wearied from His journey, was sitting thus by the well. It was about the sixth hour.
speaker: Narrator

text: There came a woman of Samaria to draw water. Jesus said to her, “Give Me a drink.”
speaker: Narrator

text: For His disciples had gone away into the city to buy food.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore the Samaritan woman said to Him, “How is it that You, being a Jew, ask me for a drink since I am a Samaritan woman?” (For Jews have no dealings with Samaritans.)
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered and said to her, “If you knew the gift of God, and who it is who says to you, ‘Give Me a drink,’ you would have asked Him, and He would have given you living water.”
speaker: Narrator

text: She said to Him, “Sir, You have nothing to draw with and the well is deep; where then do You get that living water?
speaker: Narrator

text: You are not greater than our father Jacob, are You, who gave us the well, and drank of it himself and his sons and his cattle?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered and said to her, “Everyone who drinks of this water will thirst again;
speaker: Narrator

text: but whoever drinks of the water that I will give him shall never thirst; but the water that I will give him will become in him a well of water springing up to eternal life.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The woman said to Him, “Sir, give me this water, so I will not be thirsty nor come all the way here to draw.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to her, “Go, call your husband and come here.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The woman answered and said, “I have no husband.” Jesus said to her, “You have correctly said, ‘I have no husband’;
speaker: Narrator

text: for you have had five husbands, and the one whom you now have is not your husband; this you have said truly.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The woman said to Him, “Sir, I perceive that You are a prophet.
speaker: Narrator

text: Our fathers worshiped in this mountain, and you people say that in Jerusalem is the place where men ought to worship.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to her, “Woman, believe Me, an hour is coming when neither in this mountain nor in Jerusalem will you worship the Father.
speaker: Narrator

text: You worship what you do not know; we worship what we know, for salvation is from the Jews.
speaker: Narrator

text: But an hour is coming, and now is, when the true worshipers will worship the Father in spirit and truth; for such people the Father seeks to be His worshipers.
speaker: Narrator

text: God is spirit, and those who worship Him must worship in spirit and truth.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The woman said to Him, “I know that Messiah is coming (He who is called Christ); when that One comes, He will declare all things to us.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to her, “I who speak to you am He.”
speaker: Narrator

text: At this point His disciples came, and they were amazed that He had been speaking with a woman, yet no one said, “What do You seek?” or, “Why do You speak with her?”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the woman left her waterpot, and went into the city and said to the men,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Come, see a man who told me all the things that I have done; this is not the Christ, is it?”
speaker: Narrator

text: They went out of the city, and were coming to Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Meanwhile the disciples were urging Him, saying, “Rabbi, eat.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But He said to them, “I have food to eat that you do not know about.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the disciples were saying to one another, “No one brought Him anything to eat, did he?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to them, “My food is to do the will of Him who sent Me and to accomplish His work.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do you not say, ‘There are yet four months, and then comes the harvest’? Behold, I say to you, lift up your eyes and look on the fields, that they are white for harvest.
speaker: Narrator

text: Already he who reaps is receiving wages and is gathering fruit for life eternal; so that he who sows and he who reaps may rejoice together.
speaker: Narrator

text: For in this case the saying is true, ‘One sows and another reaps.’
speaker: Narrator

text: I sent you to reap that for which you have not labored; others have labored and you have entered into their labor.”
speaker: Narrator

text: From that city many of the Samaritans believed in Him because of the word of the woman who testified, “He told me all the things that I have done.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So when the Samaritans came to Jesus, they were asking Him to stay with them; and He stayed there two days.
speaker: Narrator

text: Many more believed because of His word;
speaker: Narrator

text: and they were saying to the woman, “It is no longer because of what you said that we believe, for we have heard for ourselves and know that this One is indeed the Savior of the world.”
speaker: Narrator

text: After the two days He went forth from there into Galilee.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Jesus Himself testified that a prophet has no honor in his own country.
speaker: Narrator

text: So when He came to Galilee, the Galileans received Him, having seen all the things that He did in Jerusalem at the feast; for they themselves also went to the feast.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore He came again to Cana of Galilee where He had made the water wine. And there was a royal official whose son was sick at Capernaum.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he heard that Jesus had come out of Judea into Galilee, he went to Him and was imploring Him to come down and heal his son; for he was at the point of death.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Jesus said to him, “Unless you people see signs and wonders, you simply will not believe.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The royal official said to Him, “Sir, come down before my child dies.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to him, “Go; your son lives.” The man believed the word that Jesus spoke to him and started off.
speaker: Narrator

text: As he was now going down, his slaves met him, saying that his son was living.
speaker: Narrator

text: So he inquired of them the hour when he began to get better. Then they said to him, “Yesterday at the seventh hour the fever left him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the father knew that it was at that hour in which Jesus said to him, “Your son lives”; and he himself believed and his whole household.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is again a second sign that Jesus performed when He had come out of Judea into Galilee.
speaker: Narrator

text: After these things there was a feast of the Jews, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now there is in Jerusalem by the sheep gate a pool, which is called in Hebrew Bethesda, having five porticoes.
speaker: Narrator

text: In these lay a multitude of those who were sick, blind, lame, and withered, [waiting for the moving of the waters;
speaker: Narrator

text: for an angel of the Lord went down at certain seasons into the pool and stirred up the water; whoever then first, after the stirring up of the water, stepped in was made well from whatever disease with which he was afflicted.]
speaker: Narrator

text: A man was there who had been ill for thirty-eight years.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus saw him lying there, and knew that he had already been a long time in that condition, He said to him, “Do you wish to get well?”
speaker: Narrator

text: The sick man answered Him, “Sir, I have no man to put me into the pool when the water is stirred up, but while I am coming, another steps down before me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to him, “Get up, pick up your pallet and walk.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Immediately the man became well, and picked up his pallet and began to walk.
Now it was the Sabbath on that day.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Jews were saying to the man who was cured, “It is the Sabbath, and it is not permissible for you to carry your pallet.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But he answered them, “He who made me well was the one who said to me, ‘Pick up your pallet and walk.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: They asked him, “Who is the man who said to you, ‘Pick up your pallet and walk’?”
speaker: Narrator

text: But the man who was healed did not know who it was, for Jesus had slipped away while there was a crowd in that place.
speaker: Narrator

text: Afterward Jesus found him in the temple and said to him, “Behold, you have become well; do not sin anymore, so that nothing worse happens to you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The man went away, and told the Jews that it was Jesus who had made him well.
speaker: Narrator

text: For this reason the Jews were persecuting Jesus, because He was doing these things on the Sabbath.
speaker: Narrator

text: But He answered them, “My Father is working until now, and I Myself am working.”
speaker: Narrator

text: For this reason therefore the Jews were seeking all the more to kill Him, because He not only was breaking the Sabbath, but also was calling God His own Father, making Himself equal with God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore Jesus answered and was saying to them, “Truly, truly, I say to you, the Son can do nothing of Himself, unless it is something He sees the Father doing; for whatever the Father does, these things the Son also does in like manner.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Father loves the Son, and shows Him all things that He Himself is doing; and the Father will show Him greater works than these, so that you will marvel.
speaker: Narrator

text: For just as the Father raises the dead and gives them life, even so the Son also gives life to whom He wishes.
speaker: Narrator

text: For not even the Father judges anyone, but He has given all judgment to the Son,
speaker: Narrator

text: so that all will honor the Son even as they honor the Father. He who does not honor the Son does not honor the Father who sent Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Truly, truly, I say to you, he who hears My word, and believes Him who sent Me, has eternal life, and does not come into judgment, but has passed out of death into life.
speaker: Narrator

text: Truly, truly, I say to you, an hour is coming and now is, when the dead will hear the voice of the Son of God, and those who hear will live.
speaker: Narrator

text: For just as the Father has life in Himself, even so He gave to the Son also to have life in Himself;
speaker: Narrator

text: and He gave Him authority to execute judgment, because He is the Son of Man.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not marvel at this; for an hour is coming, in which all who are in the tombs will hear His voice,
speaker: Narrator

text: and will come forth; those who did the good deeds to a resurrection of life, those who committed the evil deeds to a resurrection of judgment.
speaker: Narrator

text: “I can do nothing on My own initiative. As I hear, I judge; and My judgment is just, because I do not seek My own will, but the will of Him who sent Me.
speaker: Narrator

text: “If I alone testify about Myself, My testimony is not true.
speaker: Narrator

text: There is another who testifies of Me, and I know that the testimony which He gives about Me is true.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have sent to John, and he has testified to the truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the testimony which I receive is not from man, but I say these things so that you may be saved.
speaker: Narrator

text: He was the lamp that was burning and was shining and you were willing to rejoice for a while in his light.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the testimony which I have is greater than the testimony of John; for the works which the Father has given Me to accomplish—the very works that I do—testify about Me, that the Father has sent Me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Father who sent Me, He has testified of Me. You have neither heard His voice at any time nor seen His form.
speaker: Narrator

text: You do not have His word abiding in you, for you do not believe Him whom He sent.
speaker: Narrator

text: You search the Scriptures because you think that in them you have eternal life; it is these that testify about Me;
speaker: Narrator

text: and you are unwilling to come to Me so that you may have life.
speaker: Narrator

text: I do not receive glory from men;
speaker: Narrator

text: but I know you, that you do not have the love of God in yourselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have come in My Father’s name, and you do not receive Me; if another comes in his own name, you will receive him.
speaker: Narrator

text: How can you believe, when you receive glory from one another and you do not seek the glory that is from the one and only God?
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not think that I will accuse you before the Father; the one who accuses you is Moses, in whom you have set your hope.
speaker: Narrator

text: For if you believed Moses, you would believe Me, for he wrote about Me.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if you do not believe his writings, how will you believe My words?”
speaker: Narrator

text: After these things Jesus went away to the other side of the Sea of Galilee (or Tiberias).
speaker: Narrator

text: A large crowd followed Him, because they saw the signs which He was performing on those who were sick.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus went up on the mountain, and there He sat down with His disciples.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the Passover, the feast of the Jews, was near.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore Jesus, lifting up His eyes and seeing that a large crowd was coming to Him, said to Philip, “Where are we to buy bread, so that these may eat?”
speaker: Narrator

text: This He was saying to test him, for He Himself knew what He was intending to do.
speaker: Narrator

text: Philip answered Him, “Two hundred denarii worth of bread is not sufficient for them, for everyone to receive a little.”
speaker: Narrator

text: One of His disciples, Andrew, Simon Peter’s brother, said to Him,
speaker: Narrator

text: “There is a lad here who has five barley loaves and two fish, but what are these for so many people?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said, “Have the people sit down.” Now there was much grass in the place. So the men sat down, in number about five thousand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus then took the loaves, and having given thanks, He distributed to those who were seated; likewise also of the fish as much as they wanted.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they were filled, He said to His disciples, “Gather up the leftover fragments so that nothing will be lost.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So they gathered them up, and filled twelve baskets with fragments from the five barley loaves which were left over by those who had eaten.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore when the people saw the sign which He had performed, they said, “This is truly the Prophet who is to come into the world.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Jesus, perceiving that they were intending to come and take Him by force to make Him king, withdrew again to the mountain by Himself alone.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when evening came, His disciples went down to the sea,
speaker: Narrator

text: and after getting into a boat, they started to cross the sea to Capernaum. It had already become dark, and Jesus had not yet come to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sea began to be stirred up because a strong wind was blowing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then, when they had rowed about three or four miles, they saw Jesus walking on the sea and drawing near to the boat; and they were frightened.
speaker: Narrator

text: But He said to them, “It is I; do not be afraid.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So they were willing to receive Him into the boat, and immediately the boat was at the land to which they were going.
speaker: Narrator

text: The next day the crowd that stood on the other side of the sea saw that there was no other small boat there, except one, and that Jesus had not entered with His disciples into the boat, but that His disciples had gone away alone.
speaker: Narrator

text: There came other small boats from Tiberias near to the place where they ate the bread after the Lord had given thanks.
speaker: Narrator

text: So when the crowd saw that Jesus was not there, nor His disciples, they themselves got into the small boats, and came to Capernaum seeking Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they found Him on the other side of the sea, they said to Him, “Rabbi, when did You get here?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered them and said, “Truly, truly, I say to you, you seek Me, not because you saw signs, but because you ate of the loaves and were filled.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not work for the food which perishes, but for the food which endures to eternal life, which the Son of Man will give to you, for on Him the Father, God, has set His seal.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore they said to Him, “What shall we do, so that we may work the works of God?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered and said to them, “This is the work of God, that you believe in Him whom He has sent.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So they said to Him, “What then do You do for a sign, so that we may see, and believe You? What work do You perform?
speaker: Narrator

text: Our fathers ate the manna in the wilderness; as it is written, ‘He gave them bread out of heaven to eat.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus then said to them, “Truly, truly, I say to you, it is not Moses who has given you the bread out of heaven, but it is My Father who gives you the true bread out of heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the bread of God is that which comes down out of heaven, and gives life to the world.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they said to Him, “Lord, always give us this bread.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to them, “I am the bread of life; he who comes to Me will not hunger, and he who believes in Me will never thirst.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I said to you that you have seen Me, and yet do not believe.
speaker: Narrator

text: All that the Father gives Me will come to Me, and the one who comes to Me I will certainly not cast out.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I have come down from heaven, not to do My own will, but the will of Him who sent Me.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the will of Him who sent Me, that of all that He has given Me I lose nothing, but raise it up on the last day.
speaker: Narrator

text: For this is the will of My Father, that everyone who beholds the Son and believes in Him will have eternal life, and I Myself will raise him up on the last day.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore the Jews were grumbling about Him, because He said, “I am the bread that came down out of heaven.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They were saying, “Is not this Jesus, the son of Joseph, whose father and mother we know? How does He now say, ‘I have come down out of heaven’?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered and said to them, “Do not grumble among yourselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: No one can come to Me unless the Father who sent Me draws him; and I will raise him up on the last day.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is written in the prophets, ‘And they shall all be taught of God.’ Everyone who has heard and learned from the Father, comes to Me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Not that anyone has seen the Father, except the One who is from God; He has seen the Father.
speaker: Narrator

text: Truly, truly, I say to you, he who believes has eternal life.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am the bread of life.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your fathers ate the manna in the wilderness, and they died.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the bread which comes down out of heaven, so that one may eat of it and not die.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am the living bread that came down out of heaven; if anyone eats of this bread, he will live forever; and the bread also which I will give for the life of the world is My flesh.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Jews began to argue with one another, saying, “How can this man give us His flesh to eat?”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Jesus said to them, “Truly, truly, I say to you, unless you eat the flesh of the Son of Man and drink His blood, you have no life in yourselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: He who eats My flesh and drinks My blood has eternal life, and I will raise him up on the last day.
speaker: Narrator

text: For My flesh is true food, and My blood is true drink.
speaker: Narrator

text: He who eats My flesh and drinks My blood abides in Me, and I in him.
speaker: Narrator

text: As the living Father sent Me, and I live because of the Father, so he who eats Me, he also will live because of Me.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the bread which came down out of heaven; not as the fathers ate and died; he who eats this bread will live forever.”
speaker: Narrator

text: These things He said in the synagogue as He taught in Capernaum.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore many of His disciples, when they heard this said, “This is a difficult statement; who can listen to it?”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus, conscious that His disciples grumbled at this, said to them, “Does this cause you to stumble?
speaker: Narrator

text: What then if you see the Son of Man ascending to where He was before?
speaker: Narrator

text: It is the Spirit who gives life; the flesh profits nothing; the words that I have spoken to you are spirit and are life.
speaker: Narrator

text: But there are some of you who do not believe.” For Jesus knew from the beginning who they were who did not believe, and who it was that would betray Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He was saying, “For this reason I have said to you, that no one can come to Me unless it has been granted him from the Father.”
speaker: Narrator

text: As a result of this many of His disciples withdrew and were not walking with Him anymore.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Jesus said to the twelve, “You do not want to go away also, do you?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Simon Peter answered Him, “Lord, to whom shall we go? You have words of eternal life.
speaker: Narrator

text: We have believed and have come to know that You are the Holy One of God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered them, “Did I Myself not choose you, the twelve, and yet one of you is a devil?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now He meant Judas the son of Simon Iscariot, for he, one of the twelve, was going to betray Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: After these things Jesus was walking in Galilee, for He was unwilling to walk in Judea because the Jews were seeking to kill Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the feast of the Jews, the Feast of Booths, was near.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore His brothers said to Him, “Leave here and go into Judea, so that Your disciples also may see Your works which You are doing.
speaker: Narrator

text: For no one does anything in secret when he himself seeks to be known publicly. If You do these things, show Yourself to the world.”
speaker: Narrator

text: For not even His brothers were believing in Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Jesus said to them, “My time is not yet here, but your time is always opportune.
speaker: Narrator

text: The world cannot hate you, but it hates Me because I testify of it, that its deeds are evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: Go up to the feast yourselves; I do not go up to this feast because My time has not yet fully come.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Having said these things to them, He stayed in Galilee.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when His brothers had gone up to the feast, then He Himself also went up, not publicly, but as if, in secret.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Jews were seeking Him at the feast and were saying, “Where is He?”
speaker: Narrator

text: There was much grumbling among the crowds concerning Him; some were saying, “He is a good man”; others were saying, “No, on the contrary, He leads the people astray.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet no one was speaking openly of Him for fear of the Jews.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when it was now the midst of the feast Jesus went up into the temple, and began to teach.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Jews then were astonished, saying, “How has this man become learned, having never been educated?”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Jesus answered them and said, “My teaching is not Mine, but His who sent Me.
speaker: Narrator

text: If anyone is willing to do His will, he will know of the teaching, whether it is of God or whether I speak from Myself.
speaker: Narrator

text: He who speaks from himself seeks his own glory; but He who is seeking the glory of the One who sent Him, He is true, and there is no unrighteousness in Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Did not Moses give you the Law, and yet none of you carries out the Law? Why do you seek to kill Me?”
speaker: Narrator

text: The crowd answered, “You have a demon! Who seeks to kill You?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered them, “I did one deed, and you all marvel.
speaker: Narrator

text: For this reason Moses has given you circumcision (not because it is from Moses, but from the fathers), and on the Sabbath you circumcise a man.
speaker: Narrator

text: If a man receives circumcision on the Sabbath so that the Law of Moses will not be broken, are you angry with Me because I made an entire man well on the Sabbath?
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not judge according to appearance, but judge with righteous judgment.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So some of the people of Jerusalem were saying, “Is this not the man whom they are seeking to kill?
speaker: Narrator

text: Look, He is speaking publicly, and they are saying nothing to Him. The rulers do not really know that this is the Christ, do they?
speaker: Narrator

text: However, we know where this man is from; but whenever the Christ may come, no one knows where He is from.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus cried out in the temple, teaching and saying, “You both know Me and know where I am from; and I have not come of Myself, but He who sent Me is true, whom you do not know.
speaker: Narrator

text: I know Him, because I am from Him, and He sent Me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So they were seeking to seize Him; and no man laid his hand on Him, because His hour had not yet come.
speaker: Narrator

text: But many of the crowd believed in Him; and they were saying, “When the Christ comes, He will not perform more signs than those which this man has, will He?”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Pharisees heard the crowd muttering these things about Him, and the chief priests and the Pharisees sent officers to seize Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore Jesus said, “For a little while longer I am with you, then I go to Him who sent Me.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will seek Me, and will not find Me; and where I am, you cannot come.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Jews then said to one another, “Where does this man intend to go that we will not find Him? He is not intending to go to the Dispersion among the Greeks, and teach the Greeks, is He?
speaker: Narrator

text: What is this statement that He said, ‘You will seek Me, and will not find Me; and where I am, you cannot come’?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now on the last day, the great day of the feast, Jesus stood and cried out, saying, “If anyone is thirsty, let him come to Me and drink.
speaker: Narrator

text: He who believes in Me, as the Scripture said, ‘From his innermost being will flow rivers of living water.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: But this He spoke of the Spirit, whom those who believed in Him were to receive; for the Spirit was not yet given, because Jesus was not yet glorified.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some of the people therefore, when they heard these words, were saying, “This certainly is the Prophet.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Others were saying, “This is the Christ.” Still others were saying, “Surely the Christ is not going to come from Galilee, is He?
speaker: Narrator

text: Has not the Scripture said that the Christ comes from the descendants of David, and from Bethlehem, the village where David was?”
speaker: Narrator

text: So a division occurred in the crowd because of Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some of them wanted to seize Him, but no one laid hands on Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The officers then came to the chief priests and Pharisees, and they said to them, “Why did you not bring Him?”
speaker: Narrator

text: The officers answered, “Never has a man spoken the way this man speaks.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Pharisees then answered them, “You have not also been led astray, have you?
speaker: Narrator

text: No one of the rulers or Pharisees has believed in Him, has he?
speaker: Narrator

text: But this crowd which does not know the Law is accursed.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Nicodemus (he who came to Him before, being one of them) said to them,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Our Law does not judge a man unless it first hears from him and knows what he is doing, does it?”
speaker: Narrator

text: They answered him, “You are not also from Galilee, are you? Search, and see that no prophet arises out of Galilee.”
speaker: Narrator

text: [Everyone went to his home.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus went to the Mount of Olives.
speaker: Narrator

text: Early in the morning He came again into the temple, and all the people were coming to Him; and He sat down and began to teach them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The scribes and the Pharisees brought a woman caught in adultery, and having set her in the center of the court,
speaker: Narrator

text: they said to Him, “Teacher, this woman has been caught in adultery, in the very act.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now in the Law Moses commanded us to stone such women; what then do You say?”
speaker: Narrator

text: They were saying this, testing Him, so that they might have grounds for accusing Him. But Jesus stooped down and with His finger wrote on the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when they persisted in asking Him, He straightened up, and said to them, “He who is without sin among you, let him be the first to throw a stone at her.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Again He stooped down and wrote on the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they heard it, they began to go out one by one, beginning with the older ones, and He was left alone, and the woman, where she was, in the center of the court.
speaker: Narrator

text: Straightening up, Jesus said to her, “Woman, where are they? Did no one condemn you?”
speaker: Narrator

text: She said, “No one, Lord.” And Jesus said, “I do not condemn you, either. Go. From now on sin no more.”]
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus again spoke to them, saying, “I am the Light of the world; he who follows Me will not walk in the darkness, but will have the Light of life.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Pharisees said to Him, “You are testifying about Yourself; Your testimony is not true.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered and said to them, “Even if I testify about Myself, My testimony is true, for I know where I came from and where I am going; but you do not know where I come from or where I am going.
speaker: Narrator

text: You judge according to the flesh; I am not judging anyone.
speaker: Narrator

text: But even if I do judge, My judgment is true; for I am not alone in it, but I and the Father who sent Me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even in your law it has been written that the testimony of two men is true.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am He who testifies about Myself, and the Father who sent Me testifies about Me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So they were saying to Him, “Where is Your Father?” Jesus answered, “You know neither Me nor My Father; if you knew Me, you would know My Father also.”
speaker: Narrator

text: These words He spoke in the treasury, as He taught in the temple; and no one seized Him, because His hour had not yet come.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then He said again to them, “I go away, and you will seek Me, and will die in your sin; where I am going, you cannot come.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Jews were saying, “Surely He will not kill Himself, will He, since He says, ‘Where I am going, you cannot come’?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He was saying to them, “You are from below, I am from above; you are of this world, I am not of this world.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I said to you that you will die in your sins; for unless you believe that I am He, you will die in your sins.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So they were saying to Him, “Who are You?” Jesus said to them, “What have I been saying to you from the beginning?
speaker: Narrator

text: I have many things to speak and to judge concerning you, but He who sent Me is true; and the things which I heard from Him, these I speak to the world.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They did not realize that He had been speaking to them about the Father.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Jesus said, “When you lift up the Son of Man, then you will know that I am He, and I do nothing on My own initiative, but I speak these things as the Father taught Me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He who sent Me is with Me; He has not left Me alone, for I always do the things that are pleasing to Him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: As He spoke these things, many came to believe in Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Jesus was saying to those Jews who had believed Him, “If you continue in My word, then you are truly disciples of Mine;
speaker: Narrator

text: and you will know the truth, and the truth will make you free.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They answered Him, “We are Abraham’s descendants and have never yet been enslaved to anyone; how is it that You say, ‘You will become free’?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered them, “Truly, truly, I say to you, everyone who commits sin is the slave of sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: The slave does not remain in the house forever; the son does remain forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: So if the Son makes you free, you will be free indeed.
speaker: Narrator

text: I know that you are Abraham’s descendants; yet you seek to kill Me, because My word has no place in you.
speaker: Narrator

text: I speak the things which I have seen with My Father; therefore you also do the things which you heard from your father.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They answered and said to Him, “Abraham is our father.” Jesus said to them, “If you are Abraham’s children, do the deeds of Abraham.
speaker: Narrator

text: But as it is, you are seeking to kill Me, a man who has told you the truth, which I heard from God; this Abraham did not do.
speaker: Narrator

text: You are doing the deeds of your father.” They said to Him, “We were not born of fornication; we have one Father: God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to them, “If God were your Father, you would love Me, for I proceeded forth and have come from God, for I have not even come on My own initiative, but He sent Me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why do you not understand what I am saying? It is because you cannot hear My word.
speaker: Narrator

text: You are of your father the devil, and you want to do the desires of your father. He was a murderer from the beginning, and does not stand in the truth because there is no truth in him. Whenever he speaks a lie, he speaks from his own nature, for he is a liar and the father of lies.
speaker: Narrator

text: But because I speak the truth, you do not believe Me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Which one of you convicts Me of sin? If I speak truth, why do you not believe Me?
speaker: Narrator

text: He who is of God hears the words of God; for this reason you do not hear them, because you are not of God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Jews answered and said to Him, “Do we not say rightly that You are a Samaritan and have a demon?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered, “I do not have a demon; but I honor My Father, and you dishonor Me.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I do not seek My glory; there is One who seeks and judges.
speaker: Narrator

text: Truly, truly, I say to you, if anyone keeps My word he will never see death.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Jews said to Him, “Now we know that You have a demon. Abraham died, and the prophets also; and You say, ‘If anyone keeps My word, he will never taste of death.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Surely You are not greater than our father Abraham, who died? The prophets died too; whom do You make Yourself out to be?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered, “If I glorify Myself, My glory is nothing; it is My Father who glorifies Me, of whom you say, ‘He is our God’;
speaker: Narrator

text: and you have not come to know Him, but I know Him; and if I say that I do not know Him, I will be a liar like you, but I do know Him and keep His word.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your father Abraham rejoiced to see My day, and he saw it and was glad.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Jews said to Him, “You are not yet fifty years old, and have You seen Abraham?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to them, “Truly, truly, I say to you, before Abraham was born, I am.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore they picked up stones to throw at Him, but Jesus hid Himself and went out of the temple.
speaker: Narrator

text: As He passed by, He saw a man blind from birth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And His disciples asked Him, “Rabbi, who sinned, this man or his parents, that he would be born blind?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered, “It was neither that this man sinned, nor his parents; but it was so that the works of God might be displayed in him.
speaker: Narrator

text: We must work the works of Him who sent Me as long as it is day; night is coming when no one can work.
speaker: Narrator

text: While I am in the world, I am the Light of the world.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When He had said this, He spat on the ground, and made clay of the spittle, and applied the clay to his eyes,
speaker: Narrator

text: and said to him, “Go, wash in the pool of Siloam” (which is translated, Sent). So he went away and washed, and came back seeing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore the neighbors, and those who previously saw him as a beggar, were saying, “Is not this the one who used to sit and beg?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Others were saying, “This is he,” still others were saying, “No, but he is like him.” He kept saying, “I am the one.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So they were saying to him, “How then were your eyes opened?”
speaker: Narrator

text: He answered, “The man who is called Jesus made clay, and anointed my eyes, and said to me, ‘Go to Siloam and wash’; so I went away and washed, and I received sight.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They said to him, “Where is He?” He said, “I do not know.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They brought to the Pharisees the man who was formerly blind.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now it was a Sabbath on the day when Jesus made the clay and opened his eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Pharisees also were asking him again how he received his sight. And he said to them, “He applied clay to my eyes, and I washed, and I see.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore some of the Pharisees were saying, “This man is not from God, because He does not keep the Sabbath.” But others were saying, “How can a man who is a sinner perform such signs?” And there was a division among them.
speaker: Narrator

text: So they said to the blind man again, “What do you say about Him, since He opened your eyes?” And he said, “He is a prophet.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Jews then did not believe it of him, that he had been blind and had received sight, until they called the parents of the very one who had received his sight,
speaker: Narrator

text: and questioned them, saying, “Is this your son, who you say was born blind? Then how does he now see?”
speaker: Narrator

text: His parents answered them and said, “We know that this is our son, and that he was born blind;
speaker: Narrator

text: but how he now sees, we do not know; or who opened his eyes, we do not know. Ask him; he is of age, he will speak for himself.”
speaker: Narrator

text: His parents said this because they were afraid of the Jews; for the Jews had already agreed that if anyone confessed Him to be Christ, he was to be put out of the synagogue.
speaker: Narrator

text: For this reason his parents said, “He is of age; ask him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So a second time they called the man who had been blind, and said to him, “Give glory to God; we know that this man is a sinner.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He then answered, “Whether He is a sinner, I do not know; one thing I do know, that though I was blind, now I see.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So they said to him, “What did He do to you? How did He open your eyes?”
speaker: Narrator

text: He answered them, “I told you already and you did not listen; why do you want to hear it again? You do not want to become His disciples too, do you?”
speaker: Narrator

text: They reviled him and said, “You are His disciple, but we are disciples of Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: We know that God has spoken to Moses, but as for this man, we do not know where He is from.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The man answered and said to them, “Well, here is an amazing thing, that you do not know where He is from, and yet He opened my eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text: We know that God does not hear sinners; but if anyone is God-fearing and does His will, He hears him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Since the beginning of time it has never been heard that anyone opened the eyes of a person born blind.
speaker: Narrator

text: If this man were not from God, He could do nothing.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They answered him, “You were born entirely in sins, and are you teaching us?” So they put him out.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus heard that they had put him out, and finding him, He said, “Do you believe in the Son of Man?”
speaker: Narrator

text: He answered, “Who is He, Lord, that I may believe in Him?”
speaker: Narrator
